q: You are using Partitioning in Redis for larger databases which allows using the sum of the memory of many computers to avoid the problem of less memory a single computer can support. Which of the following is a type of implementation of partitioning?

You are using Partitioning in Redis for larger databases that allow using the sum of the memory of many computers to avoid the problem of less memory a single computer can support. Suppose you want to separate the customer, employees, and vendors into different nodes. Given below are the steps that you can follow in order to do so. Arrange them in the correct order.

Steps

  1. Assign cluster slots to specific nodes in the cluster.
  2. Set up a Redis Cluster.
  3. Write data for each customer, where the hset function sets the key using the hash slot function.

You are using Partitioning in Redis for larger databases which allows using the sum of the memory of many computers to avoid the problem of less memory a single computer can support. You have created a function that is used to convert the key into a number and then the data is stored in different- different Redis instances. Which of the following type of partitioning could you use to do so?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. You are not sure that whether you should use redis pipelining or not. Some of the instances are given below where you can either use the pipelining or not. Choose the correct scenarios from the following where you can use pipelining:

  1. When you need to improve your performance.
  2. When you have several commands to send to the redis server
  3. When you dont need the response of a previous command as input for a subsequent command.
  4. When you want to ensure that a set of commands you have to execute atomically

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which of the following statements about Redis are true?

Choose the correct argument for the mentioned statements:

Statements

  1. Redis uses all the well-known practices for writing secure code, to prevent buffer overflows, format bugs, and other memory corruption issues.
  2. The client can change the working dir of the program and the name of the dump file and this allows the client to write RDB files, which is a security issue that can easily lead to the ability to compromise the system.

a.option: Both statements are true and Statement 2 is correct explanation of Statement 1
Both statements are true and Statement 1 is correct explanation of Statement 2
Both statements are true but Statement 1 and Statement 2 are not related
Statement 1 is false but Statement 2 is true

q:
You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which among the following are some of the essential security measures for Redis Implementation in its infrastructure?

  1. Do not Publicly expose the redis server
  2. Run Redis with minimum privileges
  3. Don't allow any outside traffic to the Redis port
  4. Always use the private mode
  5. Prevent Network sniffing
  6. Secure Redis Implementation with Redis Enterprise Cloud

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. redis-benchmark program is a quick and useful way to get some figures and evaluate the performance of a Redis instance on a given hardware. You want to specify the number of parallel connections then which of the following will you use?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. redis-benchmark program is a quick and useful way to get some figures and evaluate the performance of a Redis instance on a given hardware.

You want to limit the tests to show the averages for the GET and SET commands using the -t. By running //command 1 in Redis you get the following output in Redis-cli:

Output
SET: 76687.12 requests per second
GET: 82576.38 requests per second

Now, if you want to increase the number of parallel connections to simulate a peak in usage to 1000 concurrent connections instead of the default 50. In order to do so you entered //command 2 in Redis-cli and got the following output:

Output
SET: 69444.45 requests per second
GET: 70821.53 requests per second

Which of the following are //command 1 and //command 2?

1.

//command 1
redis-benchmark -t set,get -c
//command 2
redis-benchmark -t set,get -c 1000

2.

//command 1
redis-benchmark -t set,get -c
//command 2
redis-benchmark -t set,get -q -c 50 1000

3.

//command 1
redis-benchmark -p set,get -q 50
//command 2
redis-benchmark -p set,get -q -t 1000

4.

//command 1
redis-benchmark -t set,get -q
//command 2
redis-benchmark -t set,get -q -c 1000

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. redis-benchmark program is a quick and useful way to get some figures and evaluate the performance of a Redis instance on a given hardware. You can limit the tests to a subset of commands of your choice. The default options will use 50 parallel connections to create 100000 requests to the Redis server. If you want to increase the number of parallel connections to simulate a peak in usage, how will it affect its performance?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. redis-benchmark program is a quick and useful way to get some figures and evaluate the performance of a Redis instance on a given hardware. If you want to check the average number of requests per second that your local Redis server can handle, which of the following will you use?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which of the following program is a quick and useful way to get some figures and evaluate the performance of a Redis instance on a given hardware?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. You are using Redis pipelining for network optimization. In which of the following types of partitioning, clients send requests to a proxy that is able to speak the Redis protocol, instead of sending requests directly to the right Redis instance?

You are using redis pipelining for the network optimization. When Redis is used as a cache, if a given node is unavailable, a different node is used, altering the key-instance map as we wish to improve the availability of the system. Consistent hashing implementations are used in the above-mentioned scenario if the preferred node for a given key is not available. 

Choose the correct argument for the below-mentioned statements :
Statement 1: If redis is used as a cache scaling up and down using consistent hashing is easy.
Statement 2: If redis is used as a store, a fixed keys-to-node map is used.

a.option: Both statements are true and Statement 2 is correct explanation of Statement 1
Both statements are true and Statement 1 is correct explanation of Statement 2
Both statements are true but Statement 1 and Statement 2 are not related
Statement 1 is false but Statement 2 is true

q:
You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application you are using Redis as a cache. Redis has optional support for TLS on which of the following:

  1. All communication channels.
  2. Client connections
  3. Replication links
  4. Redis cluster bus protocol

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. When redis is executed with the default configuration and without any password, in order to gain access it enters a special mode. What is that special mode called?

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which of the following statements about Redis are true?

Statements

  1. Redis is very fast at serving queries. Many passwords per second can be tested by an external client.
  2. Redis has optional support for TLS on all communication channels, including client connections, replication links and the redis cluster bus protocol.
  3. Redis protocol has the concept of string escaping, so injection is impossible under normal circumstances using a normal library.
  4. Using the CONFIG command makes the client able to change the working dir of the program and the name of the dump file.

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. You are using redis pipelining for the network optimization.
Which of the following is the advantage of using pipelining?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Identify the correct statement about the Redis
pipelining?

a.option: It saves the RTT(round trip time) for every command
It reduces the latency cost associated with the RTT

q: To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Redis connection commands are basically used to manage client connections with Redis server. Client connections tend to consume memory leading to data eviction or out-of-memory errors. Redis allows us a robust configuration to limit the aggregate memory used by all clients connections. This mechanism is called client eviction. Which of the following connections aren't affected by the client eviction mechanism and are never evicted?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Redis connection commands are basically used to manage client connections with Redis server. Client connections tend to consume memory leading to data eviction or out-of-memory errors. Redis allows us a robust configuration to limit the aggregate memory used by all client's connections. This mechanism is called client eviction. Which of the following statements are true for client eviction?

Statements

  1. It's a safety mechanism that will disconnect clients once the aggregate memory usage of all clients is above a threshold.
  2. The mechanism first attempts to disconnect clients that use the least memory.
  3. It disconnects the minimal number of clients needed to return below the maxmemory-clients threshold.
  4. Replica and master connections aren't affected by the client eviction mechanism.
  5. Replica and master connections are evicted first.

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Redis connection commands are basically used to manage client connections with Redis server. Different kind of clients have different default limit. What is the default hard limit and soft limit for Pub/Sub clients?

a.option: Hard limit of 256 megabytes and Soft limit of 8 megabytes per 60 seconds
Hard limit of 32 megabytes and Soft limit of 64 megabytes per 60 seconds
Hard limit of 32 megabytes and Soft limit of 8 megabytes per 60 seconds
Hard limit of 256 megabytes and Soft limit of 64 megabytes per 60 seconds

q:
To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Redis connection commands are basically used to manage client connections with the Redis server. When a new client connection is accepted which of the following operations are performed?

Operations

  1. The client socket is put in a blocking state since Redis uses multiplexing and non-blocking I/O.
  2. The TCP_NODELAY option is set in order to ensure that we don't have delays in our connection.
  3. A readable file event is created so that Redis is able to collect the client queries as soon as new data is available to be read on the socket.
  4. After the client is initialized, Redis checks if we are already at the limit of the number of clients that it is possible to handle simultaneously

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Redis connection commands are basically used to manage client connections with Redis server. How client connections are accepted?

a.option: On the configured listening IP port
On the Unix socket if enabled
On the configured listening TCP port and on the Unix socket if enabled

q:
To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You want to provide a check-and-set (CAS) behavior to Redis transactions for optimistic locking. If multiple clients try to increment the key at about the same time there will be a race condition. Which of the following code provides the form of locking:

  • So that multiple clients can access different keys, and
  • So that the collisions are unlikely, and 
  • So that there's no need to repeat the operation

Code

1.

LOCK key1
val = GET key1
val = val + 2
SET key1 $val
UNLOCK

2.

LOCK key1
val = SET key1
val = val + 2
NEXT
GET key1 $val
UNLOCK

3.

WATCH key1
val = SET key1
val = val + 10
NEXT
GET key1 $val
EXEC

4.

WATCH key1
val = GET key1
val = val + 10
MULTI
SET key1 $val
EXEC

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You want to provide a check-and-set (CAS) behavior to Redis transactions for optimistic locking.

Which of the following statements describe the best way to implement locking in Redis Transactions?

Statements

  1. LOCK and UNLOCK are used to provide a check-and-set (CAS) behavior to Redis transactions for strict optimal locking.
  2. To avoid Race conditions and provide atomicity LOCK command avoid updating the same key by multiple clients and UNLOCK when the shared key gets out of the critical section.
  3. If the shared key is unlocked multiple clients can access the key if it wants to perform some operation.
  4. WATCH is used to provide a check-and-set (CAS) behavior to Redis transactions.
  5. WATCHed keys are monitored in order to detect changes against them. If at least one watched key is modified before the EXEC command, the whole transaction aborts and EXEC returns a NULL reply to notify that the transaction failed.

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You have run the following commands in redis-cli. 

> MULTI 
> SET tutorial redis 
> GET tutorial 
> INCR visitors

What is the output of EXEC command in redis cli after running the given commands? 

Options

1.

1) ERR 
2) "OK" 
3) (integer) 1

2.

1) ERR 
2) OK 
3) (integer) 0

3.

1) OK 
2) redis 
3) (integer) 0

4.

1) OK 
2) "redis" 
3) (integer) 1
To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. How is a Redis transaction initialized and started?

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Which of the following statements are true for Transactions in Redis?

Statements

  1. They allow the execution of a group of commands in multiple steps.
  2. It can never happen that a request issued by another client is served in the middle of the execution of a Redis transaction. 
  3. Either all of the commands or none are processed, so a Redis transaction is also atomic.

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Redis Sets are good for expressing relations between objects. You want to use sets in order to implement tags. In order to do so, you have created a set for every object you want to tag. The set contains the IDs of the tags associated with the object.

If employee ID 2022 is tagged with tags 67, 128, 57 and 89, how can a set associate these IDs with the employees?

Options

1.

> sset tags employee:2022 67 128 57 89

2.

> sset employee 2022 tags 67
> sset employee 2022 tags 128
> sset employee 2022 tags 57
> sset employee 2022 tags 89

3.

> sadd employee:2022 tags 67
> sadd employee:2022 tags 128
> sadd employee:2022 tags 57
> sadd employee:2022 tags 89

4.

> sadd employee:2022:tags 67 128 57 89

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. How can you add elements to your Redis Set named "myset" in redis-cli and then print them?

Options

1.

> sset myset 1 2 3
> sshow myset

2.

> sset myset 1 2 3
> smembers myset

3.

> sadd myset 1 2 3
> smembers myset

4.

> sadd myset 1 2 3
> sget myset

Redis Lists serve as a building block for inter-process communication systems: blocking operations. The usual producer/consumer setup, and can be implemented in the following simple way:

  • To push items into the list, producers call LPUSH
  • To extract/process items from the list, consumers call RPOP

It is possible that sometimes the list is empty and there is nothing to process, then the consumer is forced to wait some time and retry again. This is called Polling. Which of the following are some of the drawbacks of Polling?

  1. All the requests when the list is empty will get no actual work done, they'll just return NULL.
  2. Clients are served in an ordered way and hence sometimes high priority processes are not served first
  3. Adds a delay to the processing of items, since after a worker receives a NULL, it waits some time.
When using social media network, you want to speed up access and see the latest photos posted by the user then which of the following data type is best suited for such a scenario?

LRANGE mylist 5 -1

Caching is an important step in increasing the performance of many applications. It can be difficult to determine which caching solution is the best for your use case. Two likely contenders that will often make an appearance in your search for the answer are Redis vs Memcached. Which of the following data types is the only data type used by Memcached?
